companyDescription: Chartered Professional Accountants of Canada (CPA Canada) is one of the largest national accounting organizations in the world and is a respected voice in the business, government, education and non-profit sectors. CPA Canada is a progressive and forward-thinking organization whose members bring a convergence of shared values, diverse business skills and exceptional talents to the accounting field. Domestically, CPA Canada works cooperatively with the provincial and territorial CPA bodies who are charged with regulating the profession. Globally, it works together with the International Federation of Accountants and the Global Accounting Alliance to build a stronger accounting profession worldwide. As one of the world’s largest national accounting bodies, CPA Canada carries a strong influential voice and acts in the public interest.
description:
About Chartered Professional Accountants of Canada
            Chartered Professional Accountants of Canada (CPA Canada) works collaboratively with the provincial, territorial and Bermudian CPA bodies, as it represents the Canadian accounting profession, both nationally and internationally. This collaboration allows the Canadian profession to champion best practices that benefit business and society, as well as prepare its members for an ever-evolving operating environment featuring unprecedented change. Representing more than 220,000 members, CPA Canada is one of the largest national accounting bodies worldwide.
           
            About the opportunity
            In 2023, the Canadian Sustainability Standards Board (CSSB) was formed. The CSSB works alongside Canada’s existing accounting and assurance boards and liaises with the International Sustainability Standards Board (ISSB) and International Public Sector Accounting Standards Board (IPSASB). Within this context, CPA Canada’s Standards Group seeks a Principal, Sustainability. This role, which reports directly to the Vice President, Sustainability Standards, offers a unique and ground-breaking opportunity to shape future international sustainability standards.
            The position offers the flexibility of remote work or a more traditional work option based out of any of CPA Canada's offices in Montreal, Ottawa, Toronto or Burnaby. Periodic travel is required. The targeted base salary range for this position is $115k to $130k and is commensurate with experience.
           
            What you'll do
            In this role, you will:
           
             Work within a globally-respected due process rooted in consultation and consensus-building
             Serve the public interest by advancing sustainability standards and supporting the quality and accuracy of their resultant disclosures
             Conduct market research to inform proposals and data-driven decisions of the CSSB
             Establish positions on concepts and terminology affecting the scope and application of international and domestic sustainability disclosure standards
             Prepare draft responses to public consultations of global standard setters on behalf of the CSSB
             Participate in education/outreach activities to support capacity building in sustainability disclosure
             Identify and cultivate strategic relationships with key market participants
             Contribute to internal process improvement to support the smooth functioning of the CSSB
             Prepare reports, presentations and other material for internal and external use, ensuring new or complex topics are communicated in plain language
             Represent the organization at conferences, roundtables, committees and other external forums
             Support the training and development of new staff members within a growing team
           
           
            What we seek
            The preferred candidate will hold an undergraduate or graduate degree in general business, sustainability, environmental studies, finance, accounting or other relevant education and credentials. This background will be supplemented by 8 to 10 years of professional experience in which the following skills and attributes have been applied:
           
             Passion for advancing societal and environmental imperatives through standard setting
             Understanding of global sustainability reporting initiatives (e.g. ISSB, GRI, EFRAG) and an ability to link financial, social and environmental considerations
             Commitment to the core tenets of standards development, including consultation, transparency and accountability
             Client service mindset with strong listening skills, respect for divergent views and a proven ability to assess and resolve issues creatively; comfortable presenting ideas, facilitating plans and building consensus
             Solutions-oriented approach driven by research, analysis and critical reasoning
             Superior verbal and written skills with an emphasis on clear, concise and effective communication
             Pride in workmanship; ability to manage and be accountable for complex projects with unwavering attention to integrity, deadlines and quality
             Ability to work autonomously or collaboratively across departmental functions as needed
             Understanding of Indigenous rights, interests and worldviews through lived experience or a background in Indigenous studies, or a genuine willingness to learn
             A Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) designation and bilingualism in French and English would be considered strong assets.
           
           
            What it's like to work here
            CPA Canada is an inclusive place to work with a diverse workforce and a commitment to health and wellness for its employees. Should you require accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact careers@cpacanada.ca. The organization offers a flexible and balanced environment that allows individuals to maximize professional and personal development. CPA Canada employs over 400 people, with its headquarters in Toronto and regional offices in Burnaby, Ottawa and Montreal. Our technology-enabled culture is designed to attract qualified people and enable them to do their best work. Employee perks include competitive salaries and pension, a comprehensive benefits package, professional development programs, flexible working hours and opportunities to work from home, regular social events and a successful employee volunteer program. CPA Canada is dedicated to continual improvement and building a high-performing, innovative organization that creates value for members and other stakeholders.
           
            Organization values  We create a collaborative and constructive culture by:  • Acting with Integrity • Fostering Excellence • Respecting Others • Working Collaboratively • Being Accountable
            CPA Canada is committed to cultivating an inclusive, accessible environment, where each employee feels respected, valued and supported. All qualified individuals may apply online. If you require a disability-related accommodation to participate in our recruitment process, please note this in your application. We'll be happy to work with you to meet your needs.
